intro: Endressia castellana, commonly known as the Castellana's endressia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
